metadata.title: CVE-2022-48839 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net/packet: fix slab-out-of-bounds access in packet_recvmsg()syzbot found that when an AF_PACKET socket is using PACKET_COPY_THRESHand mmap operations, tpacket_rcv() is queueing skbs withgarbage in skb->cb[], triggering a too big copy [1]Presumably, users of af_packet using mmap() already gets correctmetadata from the mapped buffer, we can simply make sureto clear 12 bytes that might be copied to user space later.BUG: KASAN: stack-out-of-bounds in memcpyinclude/linux/fortify-string.h:225 [inline]BUG:
